KPK Minta Hakim Tolak Praperadilan Nyoman Dhamantra
04 Nov 2019, 21:10 by Yulida Medistiara
Jakarta - KPK meminta hakim menolak gugatan praperadilan yang diajukan I Nyoman Dhamantra dalam kasus suap impor bawang putih. KPK menyatakan penetapan tersangka sudah sesuai prosedur.
"Menolak permohonan praperadilan yang diajukan pemohon sebagaimana terdaftar dalam register perkara nomor 126/Pid.Pra/2019/PN.Jkt.Sel atau setidaknya menyatakan permohonan pemohon tidak dapat diterima," kata tim biro hukum KPK, Togi Sirait, saat membacakan jawaban dalam sidang praperadilan di PN Jaksel, Jl Ampera Raya, Jakarta Selatan, Senin (4/11/2019).
KPK juga meminta penetapan tersangka, penyidikan, penyitaan dan penahanan terhadap pemohon dinyatakan sah oleh hakim praperadilan.
KPK menyebut proses penyidikan dan penetapan tersangka sudah sesuai bukti permulaan yang cukup sekurang-kurangnya dua alat bukti sesuai KUHAP dan UU KPK.
KPK mengatakan awalnya menerima laporan terkait dugaan tindak pidana, selanjutnya membuat laporan hasil penyelidikan pada 8 Agustus kepada pimpinan.
Setelah itu dilakukan gelar perkara, diperoleh sejumlah barang bukti berupa surat atau dokumen, keterangan dari 12 orang termasuk pemohon Nyoman Dhamantra, bukti uang, bukti petunjuk berupa hasil penyadapan antara orang yang diduga terlibat dan lainnya.
Setelah menemukan barang bukti tersebut, barulah KPK meningkatkan status hukum ke tahap penyidikan. KPK meyakini tangkap tangan yang dilakukan sudah sesuai prosedur.
"Tindakan tangkap tangan yang dilakukan termohon dalam perkara aquo telah sesuai dengan ketentuan hukum acara yang berlaku sebagaimana diatur di KUHAP dan UU KPK," sambungnya.

KPK Asks Judges to Reject Pre-trial Nyoman Dhamantra
Nov 04 2019, 21:10 by Yulida Medistiara
Jakarta - The KPK asked the judge to reject the pretrial lawsuit filed by I Nyoman Dhamantra in the case of bribery imports of garlic. The KPK stated that the determination of suspects was in accordance with procedures.
"Refusing a pretrial petition filed by the applicant as registered in the case register number 126 / Pid.Pra / 2019 / PN.Jkt.Sel or at least stating the petition of the applicant cannot be accepted," said the KPK law firm team, Togi Sirait, when reading the answers in the trial pretrial at South Jakarta District Court, Jl Ampera Raya, South Jakarta, Monday (11/04/2019).
The KPK also requested that the determination of suspects, investigations, confiscations and detention of the petitioners be declared valid by the pretrial judge.
The KPK said the process of investigating and determining suspects was in accordance with initial evidence which was sufficient at least two pieces of evidence in accordance with the Criminal Procedure Code and the KPK Law.
The KPK said it initially received a report related to alleged criminal acts, then made a report on the results of the investigation on 8 August to the leadership.
After that the case was held, a number of pieces of evidence were obtained in the form of letters or documents, information from 12 people including the applicant Nyoman Dhamantra, proof of money, evidence of evidence in the form of wiretapping results between people suspected of being involved and others.
After finding the evidence, the KPK will increase the legal status to the investigation stage. KPK believes that the arrests carried out are in accordance with procedures.
"The act of arresting the respondent in the Aquo case is in accordance with the applicable procedural law as regulated in the Criminal Procedure Code and the KPK Law," he continued.
